content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron plate production setup at position around (16.0, 71.0)
Consists of the following connected entities:
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) facing down, extracting iron ore
- Stone furnace at position (16.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates
- Wooden chest at position (17.5, 73.5) collecting iron plates from the furnace
- Burner inserter at position (16.5, 74.5) moving iron ore from the mining drill to the furnace
- Burner inserter at position (18.5, 73.5) moving iron plates from the furnace to the wooden chest

This structure forms a compact iron plate production line where raw iron ore is mined, smelted, and output stored.

ERROR TIPS

### Errors placing inserters next to occupied tiles
- When placing an inserter next to another entity (e.g., wooden chest), ensure there is enough spacing or try changing the direction or reference position to avoid overlap.
- Before placing entities, check the target tile is free to prevent placement exceptions.

### Inserters and drills running out of fuel
- Inserters and drills require fuel (coal) to operate. Make sure to consistently insert coal into these entities to keep them working.
- Monitor fuel levels and automate fuel supply if possible to avoid stoppages.

### Inserters waiting for source items or destination space
- Inserters may show status waiting for source items if the input inventory is empty.
- Inserters may wait for space in destination if the output inventory (e.g., chest) is full or not accepting items.
- Ensure continuous supply of input materials and sufficient output storage capacity.

### Attempting to insert items not present in inventory
- Avoid trying to insert items (e.g., coal) into entities if the agent’s inventory does not contain those items.
- Check inventory quantities before insertion commands to prevent exceptions.

NAMESPACE
No user-defined functions have been defined by the agent so far.
